page.title: 15The Old Stables Dalgety Bay.
page.content: On the way to the Sailing Club along the waterfront you will pass the Old Stables where the Earls of Moray , who owned most of the land in the area, once kept their horses and coaches. There is a very interesting story connected with the Old Stables. One of the Earl's of Moray fell in love with a lady from a notable family in the area. He proposed marriage to her and she accepted. The marriage day was set and the Earl had a splendid carriage built especially for her. The carriage was to be pulled by 3 matching pairs of immaculate white horses. The great day arrived and no one from the brides family turned up, nor did the bride , who eloped with another just before the marriage. The angry Earl vowed that the coach would never turn a wheel and had the 6 horses shot.
